description: Explores current and historical climate hazards and impacts as experienced by the main interest groups and stakeholders in the county. Response Matrix S3A Local Perspectives of Weather and Climate

fields.label: PCRA Form

Note taker
Date
What are the main seasons of the year in your area?

fields.description: E.g. rain, hail, snow, storms, temperature, wind, etc.
fields.label: What is the weather usually like during the different seasons in your area?

fields.description: Which aspects of normal seasonal weather can cause problems for your community, livelihoods, production systems or industry? (hazards due to normal climate variability)
fields.label: Aspects of normal seasonal weather that can cause problems

fields.description: Do vulnerable groups (women, elderly, young) face any particular problems? (facilitators: consult the vulnerable group profiles developed in session 2 and check livelihood roles/tasks/duties
fields.label: Do vulnerable groups face any particular problems?
Have you noticed any changes in the pattern of the seasons over the last 20 years? If so, what changes have you noticed.

fields.description: Hazards due to slow onset changes
fields.label: Which of these changes are causing problems for your community, livelihoods, production systems or industry?
Are any of these changes causing particular problems for vulnerable groups (women/elderly/youth)?

fields.description: E.g floods, droughts, storms, high winds, storm surges, tornados etc. (Hazards due to extreme weather events)
fields.label: Which major extreme weather events have happened in your area in the last 20 years?

fields.description: In what ways have they changed? (e.g. duration, frequency, intensity or other characteristic
fields.label: Has there been a change in these events over the last 20 years?
Coastal counties
Have sea levels been changing over the last 20 years? In what ways have they changed?
Have rising sea levels been causing problems for community, livelihoods, production systems or industry?
